授業目的: This course will provide an overview of how race, ethnicity and class influences both individual and collective identity.  The experience of Japanese-Americans in the U.S. will be used as a case study.  While the U.S. claims to be a democratic multi-ethnic, multi-race society, events over the past few years challenges this concept.  We will cover the various “actors” and factors that influence the past and present situation of various ethnic groups.
到達目標: Students will learn how race, class, gender, religion and culture impacts on both individual and collective identity.
特記事項:
本授業科目は、“オンライン授業60単位制限対象科目”ではありません。
The course is not subject to the 60-credit limit for online courses.
授業方法:
Four writing assignments are required. Each will count at 15 points so a total of 60 points. Class participation and attendance will count for an additional 40 points.
Online attendance is NOT permitted since there will be small group discussions and class participation in person is required.

第1回:
All classes will be conducted face-to-face.
Class overview.
第2回: What is Identity?  Discussion on Autobiography.
第13回: The Future of Identity in a Flat World. The Globalization of Identity.
